items.description: Storing cocktails or spirits in barrels to develop deeper flavors and complexity.
Making a drink directly in the serving glass by adding ingredients one by one.
Igniting citrus oils or alcohol briefly for aroma or presentation.

Briefly igniting alcohol or citrus oils for aroma and visual effect.

Flavoring a spirit by steeping herbs, spices, fruits, or other ingredients.
Pouring liquids of different densities carefully to form visible layers.
Gently pressing ingredients to release essential oils or juice without pulverizing.
Pouring a drink back and forth between two vessels to mix gently and aerate lightly.
Coating the rim of a glass with salt, sugar, or spice.
Mixing ingredients vigorously with ice to chill, dilute, and aerate.
